millsfield:images_texts:
UnITED Air Lines News
Notebook for Company Personnel
A Book of Facts and Figures About Your Company
1935 Edition

DO YOU KNOW . . .
-that an air line is the shortest distance between two
points, and that an air line is the fastest way to get from
one to the other? Sure you do.
BUT - there may be some interesting facts and
figures about the air transport business in general, and
UNITEd Air Lines in particular, that you don't know.
"wish," one of our mechanics said one day, "that the
company would send us a few notes about our planes
and operations and such things. I could use some-
thing like that." Other employes have said much the
same thing, and probably many more have had the
thought.
This is the result - a little notebook of miscellaneous
information of all kinds, mostly about our company.
Some of these facts may be brand new to you, and still
others may be so mossy that you've forgotten them. In
any case, we'll wager that after reading this, you'll be
better acquainted with our company.
We think that the mechanic said he wanted something
like this mainly because it might help him answer questions
asked by people outside the industry. The mechanic could
handle questions about the operation of the plane, all
right, but maybe someone stumped him by wanting to
know how much air express United was carrying.
Perhaps you yourself have been cornered by someone
who asked about a phase of our business with which
you weren't very familiar.
You'll probably find the
answers on the following pages.
We suggest:
Next time someone tries to embarrass you by insisting
on knowing the overall length of a 247-D, or just what
it costs to travel by air, reach for this notebook.
